revision.comment: /* top */ clean up, replaced: hynix → SK hynix, SK SK hynix → SK hynix

|cpu1chip1 = Broadcom;BCM63168U;BCM63168UKFEBG, TN1337 P40, 319192 B3A; |cpu1_cores = 2 |cpu1_type = MIPS |cpu1_type_rev = BMIPS4350 |cpu1spd = <!-- 400 MHz --> |is_doc = |bus = <!-- 8-bit, 16-bit, 32-bit, 64-bit, Leave blank for none -->
|flash1type = <!-- Parallel,Serial(SPI),SPI NOR,NAND,Compact Flash, --> |fla1_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla1chip = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |flash1size = 16 |flash1maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes -->
|ram1type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4, --> |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM, --> |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = 128 |ram1chip = SK hynix;H5TQ1G63EFR-PBC; |ram1_num = <!-- Number of Ram chips --> |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->

|serial = yes,, internal,, 4-pin header,, 3.3V TTL |jtag = <!-- Full JTAG info -->

}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== "FAST4350", "REV: 1.20C", and "PCB MADE IN CHINA" is silkscreened on the board in the FCC photos.
Text + font + formatting seems to indicate '''Pegatron''' / '''Unihan''' / etc involvement - '''Pegatron''' will be tagged as the manuf.
The FCC sample label refers to the device as the '''Home Hub 1000'''. The photos indicate is is slated for use with some '''Bell''' service..
===Probable used PSU(s)=== The power supply shown in the FCC docs is a '''Sagemcom''' branded NBS24120200VU.
{{hasPowerSupply |brand = unknown |model = NBS24120200VU |input_v=100-240 |input_a=0.6 |input_c=AC |input_conn=NEMA 1-15P |input_hz=50/60 |output_v=12 |output_a=2 |output_c=DC |output_conn=barrel |style=medium, horiz. |e_level=5 }}
